title: For Sale/Trade:  AR-15 A4 w/ Troy & KAC
postcontent:
For sale is a gently used AR-15 A4 variant (.223/5.56).  As set up, it is nearly identical to the M-16 A4, a common DMR (Designated Marksman Rifle) in use with our nations military.  Has fired around 300 rounds and has minor handling wear (as much as you'd expect it to have from the few range trips it has had).  Is in great working condition, I just wanted to explain that while it is in excellent working condition, it is not new.  It is a SAA lower, Surplus Ammo & Arms (whom used to manufacture for Armalite and Spikes before going into their own business).  Upper is a Rock River Arms.  Has KAC M5 rail system, the same in use with our US military which retail for around $390 by themselves.  Also uses a Troy flip-up rear sight, which sells for around $100-140.  Comes with the Magpul ladder rail protectors (with cuts for light and pressure switch) and P-Mag as seen.  What you see in the picture comes with the purchase (unless we negotiate otherwise).

Details:  20" HBAR 1/9 twist, chrome-lined barrel, 5.56/.223, A2 buttstock and grip and front sight, flat-top, KAC M5 RIS, Troy rear flip sight.

Any questions, or offers feel free to contact.  Am willing to negotiate in price and meet location (best offers obviously get preference).  *Greatly* preferring cash on this one, but will consider full/partial trades *only* if they are decidedly in my favor (fiber optic ACOG's, M1A, what have you got?).  Mostly looking to raise funds for my next project but would have trouble turning down the right trade.  Thank you for your time, and have a great day! 

PS:  If you are more comfortable you may call/text 9one8seven1six0six00.  Thank you for your time, have a great day!

title: For Sale/Trade:  Kel-Tec Sub2000 .40 S&W
postcontent:
The SUB-2000 is a self-loading carbine for pistol cartridges. The bolt can be locked in the rear position by the operating handle. The main safety is of protected push bolt type disconnecting the trigger bar and interlocking the hammer and sear. By rotating the barrel upwards and back, the SUB 2000 can be reduced to a size of 16" x 7" to facilitate secure storage and utilize the internal deployment lock which is operated by a proprietary key. The rear sight is of aperture type and the fluorescent front sight can be adjusted for windage and elevation.The SUB-2000 can easily be disassembled without tools for cleaning or inspection. total length open 749mm, closed 406mm, weighs 1.8kg unloaded. this model is made to fit the Glock22 40sw mag. it will also accept the 29rd ext. mag, this item is new in the box, we have all of the accessories that go with it also. covered under Keltec warranty. Comes with one glock magazine

Grab it while you can, another run of these rifles won't be produced until the coming winter!

title: For Sale:  CZ 75 SP-01 Pistol Modified For Close Quarter Combat (CQC)
postcontent: This sale is for the item pictured. This is a CZ 75 SP-01 that has been modified for close quarter combat. It has been fitted with a scope mount weaver rail. There is a reflex sight set to 50 feet mounted on the back of the rail, and a mini laser sight mounted on the front that sits below the line of sight of the reflex sight. The reflex uses ambient light to project a red dot (so no batteries needed). The pistols iron sights are true dot night sights for use in low light settings, and the pistols laser can be used in low light to even greater effectiveness. The pistol comes with two 19 round mags, and there is a spare detachable 16 round mag clipped to the front underside picatinny rail that can be released by a simple button push. This front mag makes a combat reload very easy when a spare mag is needed quickly. The pistol is more accurate than I am, and all means of sighting are pin point accurate as well. The pistol fires hollow point +P ammo with no issues, and as CZ's are notoriously well made (with some of the best metal of any pistol in production) there is little issue with wear and tear on this weapon with a "heavier load". The pistol has been fitted with after market hogue grips for comfort and better grip, as well as a metal guide rod. The adapter for front mounting the spare mag is very hard to find and not made or sold in the US any longer. Please let me know any questions you might have, I do this as a hobby and only enough rounds were put through it to test the firearm and help zero in the different sights (around 100 shots fired)

title: For Sale/Trade:  Rare 1967 Remington 700 BDL 30-06, Bushnell Elite 3200 Scope /Old brass rivet leather
postcontent:
Hi, Here we have my rare 6 digit 294xxx 1967 Remington 700 30-06. Verified by Remington on the phone and stampings on barrel are correct. It is the more desirable BDL with hinged floorplate. It also has the decorative ebony forend and ebony pistol grip end on the factory decorative walnut stock. The butt plate is the metal 2 screw. Nice condition especially considering its age. Shoots great tight groups and has nice rifling. Took it to my Remington certified pro armorer today and he said it was good to go and was impressed. It was very windy but we proceeded anyway. First he put 2 in the center at 30yds just for reference before we hopped in the truck, then he shot 3 shots at 350 yds still in bad wind. 2 shots half inch apart and the 3rd about 4 inches away. Even with the bad wind, I was impressed as he was. We were using 180 grain Remington Core-lokt so it was not the high dollar stuff nor the best selection. The Bushnell Elite 3200 scope Is 3x9x40 I believe. It is adjustable and works perfectly and smooth. The rifle has an old school leather sling that has brass rivets and looks great and period correct on the rifle. Rifle bolt action and ejection is great, even at low speeds. You do not have to be rough with it. This is not a desperation sale. 925obo. Please send any questions or offers. I may even consider trades(or a couple of them if needed) but would rather sell. Here is some more about the scope. I will even include a little ammo, God bless.

    *
          o Improve your aim with the Bushnell Elite riflescope
          o Hunting gear boasts a Multi-X Reticle and matte black finish
          o Riflescope features Rainguard water-repellent coating that causes liquid to bead up and scatter less light
          o Multi-coated optics for superior light transmission

          o One-piece aluminum tube

title: For Trade:  Wicked Lasers Spyder Arctic III 1 Watt blue laser. Burns/Cuts/Melts
postcontent:
This is a brand new Wicked Lasers Spyder III Arctic 1 watt blue laser. Right off the bat, I'll tell you that you can go on to Wicked Laser's website right now and order this very laser for $299.99. However, I won't take anything close to that. The FDA (yes FDA) has put an import ban on any handheld laser above 5mw. This particular laser is 200x more powerful then what current import allows. Actually getting your hands on one of these is VERY difficult. I'm a GM for UPS and even with my connections in customs, it still took me 6 1/2 months to get a hold of mine. From what I'm told 85% of these are seized.

However, once you DO have one, they are pretty incredible. It will burn or melt most things dark colored. You can cut through plastics, light cigs, pop balloons, start fires, etc. The beam is so powerful that if you pointed it straight up in the air, no only can you see the beam the entire way up, but the only reason it doesn't hit outer space is because our inner atmosphere diffuses the beam. If you were at sea, and pointed the beam straight out in front of you, the only reason you aren't able to see it past a certain point is because of the curvature of the Earth.

I understand this isn't what you typically see, so if you have any questions feel free to ask.

title: For Sale/Trade:  ALS CS Teargas Smoke Grenades
postcontent:
Live and unfired.  I have several smokes available, prices are as flexible if you have an offer or trade:

ALS CS Smoke  -  $100, 1 left
ALS CS Rubber Ball  -  $150 (SOLD!)
Deftec Triple-CS Smoke  -  $200

ALS CS Grenade  -  Identical to an M18 colored smoke grenade, has a burn time of approximately 30 seconds and gives off a dense cloud of teargas.  The grenade body will be hot afterwards, and is not safe to handle and has a fire risk.

ALS Rubber Ball  -  identical to the regular smoke above, but without a pyrotechnic charge.  This one does not heat up and is safe to use indoors or in dry brush, and is immediately safe to handle afterwards.

Def-Tec Triple-CS  -  This one has three separate charges, each with a 20-30 second burn time.  You throw it high into the air, and the fuze separates the three charges for a wider area of dispersion.  Essentially similar to throwing three CS smokes at once, but in a grenade only barely larger than a single grenade (still fits in normal smoke or flashbang pouches).

title: For Sale:  AR-15 5.45x39 upper, mags, accessories
location: New Port Richey, Tampa/St. Pete, Florida
postcontent:
Before there was ever Spikes or S&W complete 5.45x39 uppers, there were various gunsmiths doing great work making these uppers a reality to take advantage of cheap ammo.  This is one of them.

KKF (Kurt's Kustom Firearms), a well known operation in Florida (sadly no longer with us due to a motorcycle accident a few years ago) made many of these custom uppers.  I have one of the first.

Built on a M4 flattop AR upper, Kurt took a new 16" Bulgarian AK-74 barrel (chrome lined and designed from the ground up for the 5.45x39 cartridge) and mated it perfectly to the AR upper.  He drilled a gas port in the midlength position as well.  We then took a Young's National Match chrome bolt carrier, key, cam pin, and firing pin and got an Alexander Arms .221 Genghis bolt - AA did the first 5.45x39 uppers many years ago, and these bolts are top-notch.  

A YHM Phantom flash suppressor, YHM Spectre Length Diamond FF handguard, adjustable gas block with midlength gas tube, Badger Tactical charging handle, and Magpul MBUS sights rounded it all out.

I've got about 400 rounds through the upper.  Other than when I screwed around with the buffer weights and springs, it functions flawlessly.  I am including a Spikes T2 tungsten powder buffer and CS blue extra-power spring with it since this is the combo that runs most reliably.  Accuracy is incredible - honestly, I'm shooting 2-3 MOA with this using surplus spam can ammo - yeah, that good.  Must be the Bulgarian barrel.

I am also including another adjustable gas block with midlength tube - this is a railed block in case you decide to swap the other one out - I switched them out because I wanted to use rail-height BUIS sights.

Meticulously cleaned and maintained.

Now, there are some scratches and dings here and there, mostly on the gas block from my ham-handed attempt to remove it without using something to keep the tools from marring the metal - I've filled it/covered it with black marker and honestly it doesn't look too bad.  The replacement gas block doesn't look as bad.  I haven't "set" the set screw yet as some people may want to tweak the gas settings - but my suggestion would be once you find the sweet spot, use some blue loctite and set the screw so it doesn't move its way out after lots of rounds.

I am including (12) 30 round mags - 4 of them are Gen 1 C-Products mags, 8 of them are Gen 2 C-Products mags.  All work flawlessly, thanks to the upgraded springs and white followers in them - honestly, they work great and I've had NO problems since I upgraded them.

I've got close to $1150 in this upper and accesories and mags.  I'm asking $750 for the entire kit and caboodle.  Might consider trades, though I'm not really in need of anything right now other than good 5.56 ammo, maybe some optics/red dots - who knows?

If you are local (Central FL) I can meet you and unload some ammo on you as well - $150 per spam can of 1080 rounds.

Also have a complete lower (Stag) that I might sell as well - has Foliage Green MIAD full pistol grip, CTR stock, all internals.  Will do a package deal for the upper and lower.

Also have a Vortex SPARC red dot optic that I can include for $175 as well.

title: For Sale:  Pre-orders for Slide Fire butt stock Kit
postcontent:
Slide Fire Solutions now offers a kit with all the parts AND tools necessary to install the SSAR-15 on an AR-15 rifle with an A2 fixed stock.  No more looking around trying to find the parts or wondering what tools are needed.  The "Complete Kit" comes with everything listed below:
SSAR-15 Rifle Stock, Interface Bock, Mil-Spec 6-Position Buffer Tube, Castle Nut, H2 Buffer, Carbine Buffer Spring, End Plate, Hex Key, Spanner Wrench, Instructions, and BATFE Approval Letter.
Slide Fire Solutions ground breaking "Slide Stock" technology and ergonomic design provide the ability to Slide Fire safely - offering a new element of entertainment for recreational shooters everywhere!
Applying principles that have been used for over 40 years to Bump Fire - this new radical design enables the operator to shoot as quickly as desired without compromising their own safety or the safety of others around them.  Unlike when traditionally bump firing; the SSAR-15 allows the shooter to firmly hold their rifle and maintain complete control at all times.  In addition, as a result of the shooter pushing forward to discharge each round, the operator is able to correct their point-of-aim for each shot and prevent recoil from pushing the firearm's muzzle upward in an unsafe direction.
In principal the SSAR-15 functions similar to the Gatlin system.  When operating the Gatlin system the shooter operated a crank in a circular motion to discharge a round.  Every 1/5 of a rotation a round would be fired - the shooter would then have to continue forward another 1/5 of a rotation to fire the next round, and so on;   With the SSAR-15; the operator moves the upper assembly forward to discharge a round.  To discharge the next round the operator must again move the upper assembly forward.  Just like with the Gatlin system; a rifle equipped with the SSAR-15 will never fire automatically.
MADE IN THE USA
    * Available in Right and Left Hand Models
    * Winter Trigger Guards and some Sling Plates may not be compatible
    * SFS recommends installation of Complete Kit be performed by a qualified gunsmith
Note:
The SSAR-15 is NOT a mechanical device.  It does not perform any automatic functions, and does not increase a rifles rate of fire.
The SSAR-15 is a rifle stock.  It requires the shooter to activate the firing mechanism for each and every round that is fired.
At any time - if the shooter fails to apply forward pressure to move the firearm back into the firing condition - the firearm will not fire.

BE SURE AND CALL FOR THE BEST PRICE! Special group pre-order prices. P.O.R.

This ad is for a Group Pre-order

When we have reached a total of 18 orders for the Slide Fire Units the order will be placed with the distributor. See our Pre-Order terms for full details.

Applying principles that have been used for over 40 years to Bump Fire – this new radical design enables the operator to shoot as quickly as desired without compromising their own safety or the safety of others around them.  Unlike when traditionally bump firing; the SSAR-15 allows the shooter to firmly hold their rifle and maintain complete control at all times.  In addition, as a result of the shooter pushing forward to discharge each round, the operator is able to correct their point-of-aim for each shot and prevent recoil from pushing the firearm’s muzzle upward in an unsafe direction.

In principal the SSAR-15 functions similar to the Gatlin system.  When operating the Gatlin system the shooter operated a crank in a circular motion to discharge a round.  Every 1/5 of a rotation a round would be fired – the shooter would then have to continue forward another 1/5 of a rotation to fire the next round, and so on….  With the SSAR-15; the operator moves the upper assembly forward to discharge a round.  To discharge the next round the operator must again move the upper assembly forward.  Just like with the Gatlin system; a rifle equipped with the SSAR-15 will never fire automatically.

MADE IN THE USA

  * Available in Right and Left Hand Models

  * Winter Trigger Guards and some Sling Plates may not be compatible

  * SFS recommends installation of Complete Kit be performed by a qualified gunsmith

Note:
The SSAR-15 is NOT a mechanical device.  It does not perform any automatic functions, and does not increase a rifles rate of fire. 

The SSAR-15 is a rifle stock.  It requires the shooter to activate the firing mechanism for each and every round that is fired.

At any time - if the shooter fails to apply forward pressure to move the firearm back into the firing condition - the firearm will not fire.

_______________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________

title: For Sale:  Springfield U.S. Model 1888 Standard with original strap
postcontent:
Terrapin Pete says it's time to upgrade the artillery. That means the old Springfield has to go.
I'm going to be conservative and say this weapon is in NRA Very Good condition with a heavy lean toward the Fine side. I've seen several others rated Fine that are in a lot worse condition than this one.
This is number 538955 with an acceptance stamp of 1892.
All the typical markings for this gun are present.
It has 6 groove rifling.
The bayonet/cleaning rod is included, but the rod ends are long gone.
Unit markings on the stock are a large "22" with a smaller "12" below it. The numbers show traces of yellow paint.
On the other side of the stock is marked 22 Sep Co. I believe this is an Ohio National Guard/Militia unit. Any info on this would be appreciated.
The family legend was that it went up San Juan Hill, but of course we'll take that with a grain of salt until the actual unit can be ascertained.
This weapon is a relic and can be shipped within the US for a considerable fee.
More pictures are available upon request.

title: For Sale/Trade:  Want to trade my Pre-series 70 Colt 1911 1911A1 for an AR
postcontent:
I have a pre series 70 Colt model 1911 in excellent shape.  Everything is original except the grips (Im not really sure if these are in fact Colt grips, but I do not belive they are the orginals..although they are from the era).  

It is a 1968 commercial model with the Government slide (Colt mfg these every so often and this was one of the years).  I welcome anyone to take it in and have everything verified if they are interested, I have done this with a local 1911 collector to be sure I was selling is what I thought I was as many times people swap stuff out on these older guns.  I am looking for a cash offer or a trade for an AR-15 or a 1911 framed .40S&w for my wife.  I purchased this as a "safe gun" and thought maybe one day the value would increase.  The value decreased a bit with the economy like everything else so my loss ( a big loss) is your gain.  This would make a great shooter so I figured someone may appreciate it more than me.   I love Colt 1911's but have fallen in love with the performance of my para ordnance's (I know, I know, but for me they just feel and perform better) That said, I don't shoot my Colts all that often anymore.  I have already thinned the herd and this will be the last to go. This is a great opportunity for someone who wants an old Colt to own one.
 Thanks

title: For Sale:  NEW Flat-Top AR-15 with Quad-rail Front Sight!!!
postcontent:
This is an LRB lower (LRB is very well regarded in the M14 world, and makes an excellent AR-15 lower, too) with a Rock River Arms parts set in it, as well as a Rock River Arms collapsible stock.  Sorry, for the manufacturer, there was no LRB option, so I picked the one that matched the part set and the stock - the closest option IMHO.

It has the quad-rail flat-top front sight so that any optic you mount to the flat-top upper will not be obscured by the front sight.  This quad-rail allows the mounting of virtually anything you would like to it, from lasers to lights to custom sling mounts (either bottom or side mounts).  You can also mount the pop-up front and rear iron sights on it as well. 

The upper has a Picatinny rail system with numbered stations so that if you remove an optic, you can easily replace it at exactly the same spot.

Of course it has the flash suppressor that doubles as a compensator since the bottom is solid instead of having openings in it.  This also keeps the muzzle blast from kicking up so much dust if you are firing it from the prone position. 

THIS WEAPON IS UNFIRED.  I bought the lower and upper separate and put them together myself.  I did this because I wanted an upper with a quad-rail on the front sight to go with the flat-top rail system on the upper, and I couldn't find all of that on any gun under $1000 that was pre-assembled. 

This is my personal AR, but I am willing to part with it because I need the cash.  I am only asking $750 for it.  If you have any questions or want any other pics, please let me know.

  - Curtis
